name: Hilton Coylumbridge - Aviemore

reviews.title: great base for exploring
reviews.text: We recently returned from a 3 night break in this hotel. The hotel has recently been refurbished and our original room (in the old building) looked good but had problems with the heating. Our new room (in the new block) was clean, spacious and warm.

reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations
reviews.text: Our booking was for 3 nights with dinner on night one. As in previous reviews breakfast is very good with a wide selection of hot and cold dishes but set menu provided at dinner has a poor selection with all the 'good' choices costing £5- £10 extra. My 'well done' steak was cremated for only an extra £5.95.

reviews.title: Great setting!
reviews.text: Otherwise the staff are very pleasant and helpful with the 'adults only' time available in the pool a definite must as the hotel is VERY popular with families with small children.

reviews.title: Okay - nothing more, nothing less.
reviews.text: Try the Woodshed bar for a quiet drink.

reviews.title: What a disappointment!
reviews.text: Hotel is a great base for exploring the surrounding area as there is loads to do and see.

I have just returned from a 3 night break and had a really great time.Stayed in room number 46, recently refurbished, very nice,clean and comfortable. We had dinner on first night which was ok ,decided to eat out for the remaining nights as the dinner prices were quite expensive, breakfast was really good with plenty of choice, drink prices were ok for a hotel, 3.20 for a bottle of beer, the foyer bar had a happy hour between 5-7, 2.40 for a pint 2.45 for a small glass of wine. The hotel is really child freindly, my son had a great time in the swimming pools, the kids club was also good, my only complaint was if you wanted to use facilities e.g tennis, golf and the funhouse outwith the kids club times there was a charge. The staff were very freindly and professional and nothing was too much trouble for them. So as i said earlier had a really great time and for what i paid 207.00 for 3 nights with dinner on the first night i would have no hesitation recommending this hotel to my family and freinds.
reviews.title: great time
Great facilities
reviews.text: Excellent location, amazing scerery around this area. Loads to see and do. Pool had a child free time which was great! Chalet lodges very comfortable and recently upgraded to a very high standard.

reviews.title: Not the best 50th Birthday treat!!
reviews.text: My husband and teenage sone took me to Colymbridge Hotel to celebrate my Birthday, and not through any fault of theirs it was a disappointment.

reviews.title: Great for a weekend
reviews.text: Room was okay - two seperate rooms (mini suite) which overlooked a roof and cooling fans, which started at 6.30am in the morning - rude awakening! Spoke to reception staff - but no chance of a move! It was such a shame when all around is such beautiful countryside and the hotel was not even full.

reviews.title: A great base for exploring the area
reviews.text: No lift would be a huge problem if you were travelling with small children and all their paraphernalia.

reviews.title: Superb family holiday
reviews.text: Charged £25 for dog to stay in room for one night - total rip-off!!!

reviews.title: Brilliant for Familys
reviews.text: Stayed at th coylumbridge with my hubbie and 2 kids ages 3 and 10 in July. I was not told a bad report about this place before I went and it certainly lived up to my expectations!!

reviews.title: great family hotel
reviews.text: There is so much to do that you have to stay more than the one night.

reviews.title: Nice hotel with sad views
reviews.text: 1. WE paid for DBB and it cost around £120 for the 4 of us and the food was perfect, we are not too fussy anyway but I was very pleased with my meal. please note drinks at the meal must be paid for, only jugs of water are free and they dont seem to offer you them unless you ask.

reviews.title: Minor niggles, but overall wonderful stay for families.
reviews.text: 2. Drinks in the bars in the Hotel are EXTREMELY expensivce, especially if you drink wine, £4.95 for 125ml wine!! BUt there is a happy hour!

reviews.title: A great place for kids
reviews.text: 3. There is LOADS for the kids, Games room, activities, sweet machines, Swimming pool, outdoor activities, eg trampoling etc.

description: Hilton Coylumbridge resort hotel is set in a 65 acre woodland estate in the heart of the Cairngorms National Park. It is located close to Aviemore and is a perfect holiday destination all year round. The resort includes five restaurants and two bars including the Woodshed Bar with its roaring log fire and the American Diner sure to please the kids. The resort also includes indoor swimming pools, outdoor tennis courts, play park, spa, outdoor activity park and The Fun House for the little ones.
